title: symlinks not retained in zip archives
body:
### What happened?

When including explicit symlink `files` in `archives` with `format: zip` the symlinks are not linked properly. The filemode header indicates that it is a link, but the symlink has no target. This contrasts with the default archive format (`tar.gz`) which does properly preserve symlink targets.

### How can we reproduce this?

Consider a minimal project with the following files/links. Note that `a/x` is a symlink to `x` and `a/x2` is a symlink to `a/x`.
```
$ git ls-files | xargs ls -l 
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff    7 Nov 22 15:42 .gitignore
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff  115 Nov 22 15:53 .goreleaser.yaml
lrwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff    4 Nov 22 16:04 a/x -> ../x
lrwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff    1 Nov 22 16:04 a/x2 -> x
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff   21 Nov 22 15:45 go.mod
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff   29 Nov 22 15:45 main.go
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff    2 Nov 22 15:32 x
```

With `.goreleaser.yaml` contents:
```
project_name: test
archives:
  - id: zip
    format: zip
    files:
    - a/*
    - x
  - files:
    - a/*
    - x
```

Generate the archives:
```
$ goreleaser release --snapshot --skip-publish
  • starting release...
  • loading config file                              file=.goreleaser.yaml
  • loading environment variables
  • getting and validating git state
    • ignoring errors because this is a snapshot     error=couldn't get current branch: fatal: ambiguous argument 'HEAD': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'
    • building...                                    commit=none latest tag=v0.0.0
    • pipe skipped                                   reason=disabled during snapshot mode
  • parsing tag
  • setting defaults
  • snapshotting
    • building snapshot...                           version=0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none
  • checking distribution directory
  • loading go mod information
  • build prerequisites
  • writing effective config file
    • writing                                        config=dist/config.yaml
  • building binaries
    • building                                       binary=dist/test_darwin_arm64/test
    • building                                       binary=dist/test_linux_386/test
    • building                                       binary=dist/test_linux_amd64_v1/test
    • building                                       binary=dist/test_linux_arm64/test
    • building                                       binary=dist/test_darwin_amd64_v1/test
    • took: 1s
  • archives
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_amd64.tar.gz
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_arm64.zip
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_amd64.tar.gz
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_386.zip
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_amd64.zip
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_arm64.tar.gz
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_amd64.zip
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_386.tar.gz
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_linux_arm64.zip
    • creating                                       archive=dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_arm64.tar.gz
  • calculating checksums
  • storing release metadata
    • writing                                        file=dist/artifacts.json
    • writing                                        file=dist/metadata.json
  • release succeeded after 0s
```

When extracting the tar.gz archive, the symlinks remain intact:
```
$ (mkdir thetar && tar -C thetar -xf dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_amd64.tar.gz) && ls -lR thetar
total 1640
drwxr-xr-x  4 orawlings  staff     128 Nov 22 16:12 a
-rwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  833104 Nov 22 16:09 test
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff       2 Nov 22 15:32 x

thetar/a:
total 0
lrwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  4 Nov 22 16:04 x -> ../x
lrwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  1 Nov 22 16:04 x2 -> x
```

But when extracting the zip archive, the symlinks are lost (replaced with zero length regular files).
```
$ (mkdir thezip && cd thezip && unzip ../dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_amd64.zip) && ls -lR thezip
Archive:  ../dist/test_0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-none_darwin_amd64.zip
  inflating: a/x                     
  inflating: a/x2                    
  inflating: x                       
  inflating: test                    
total 1640
drwxr-xr-x  4 orawlings  staff     128 Nov 22 16:13 a
-rwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  833104 Nov 22 16:09 test
-rw-r--r--  1 orawlings  staff       2 Nov 22 15:32 x

thezip/a:
total 0
-rwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  0 Nov 22 16:04 x
-rwxr-xr-x  1 orawlings  staff  0 Nov 22 16:04 x2
```

### goreleaser version

```bash
goreleaser version dev
goos: darwin
goarch: amd64
module version: v1.13.0, checksum: h1:wg7KX6osE+qm0ydBw/B00LQGqXD7qbGXPNDTyBPe/p4=

https://goreleaser.com
```
